lead_paragraph: Todd McLellan, an assistant coach for the Stanley Cup champion Detroit Red Wings, was named coach of the San Jose Sharks on Thursday. McLellan replaced Ron Wilson, who was fired May 12 after the Sharks failed to get past the second round of the playoffs for the third year in a row despite winning a division title. Wilson was named coach of Toronto on Tuesday.
